abstract: New York Mets general manager Sandy Alderson, hoping to draw large crowd after home opener, will start ace Matt Harvey in second home game; season opener at home will likely sell out regardless, but fans may come out in droves to see Harvey's first home appearance since Tommy John surgery in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Sandy Alderson acknowledged that one reason the Mets decided not to start Matt Harvey in their home opener was that they hoped by holding him back a day to get more people to attend that game.

headline.main: Home Opener? Mets Are Hoping for Big Crowd the Night After
headline.print_headline: Home Opener? Mets Are Hoping for Big Crowd the Night After

snippet: Sandy Alderson acknowledged that one reason the Mets decided not to start Matt Harvey in their home opener was that they hoped by holding him back a day to get more people to attend that game.
